nodes.name: Dataset Structured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset was defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: dataset
fields.title: Dataset
fields.description: Selected Dataset

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT 
    *,
    MIN(Temperature) OVER () AS min_temp,
    MAX(Temperature) OVER () AS max_temp
FROM 
    fire_temp_table;
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

fields.title: Output Column Names
fields.description: Name of the Output Columns

fields.title: Output Column Types
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.title: Output Column Formats
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

nodes.name: Save CSV
nodes.description: Saves the DataFrame into the specified location in CSV Format

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path where to save the CSV files

fields.name: saveMode
fields.title: Save Mode
fields.description: Whether to Append, Overwrite or Error if the path Exists

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Should a Header Row be saved with each File?

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.name: partitionColNames
fields.title: Partition Column Names
